items.sentence: Tom and Mary have no idea what John intends to do.
Tom looked like he was ready to jump out a window.
I\'m sure that your parents are very proud of you.
Tom can understand Mary\'s problem to some extent.
Tom can\'t even afford to buy a new pair of shoes.
I found a pair of sunglasses by the swimming pool.
I fully intend to do everything I said I would do.
I think that\'s why Tom doesn\'t have any friends.
Tom lost the book he\'d borrowed from the library.
Tom renewed his driver\'s license three weeks ago.
Do you know for sure that these are real diamonds?
Does it really matter which one of these I choose?
Tom didn\'t want to tell anybody where he\'d been.
Tom tried to tell Mary what he was planning to do.
Tom understood exactly what Mary wanted him to do.
Tom unfolded the newspaper and started to read it.
Tom offered to help the old lady cross the street.
Tom realized that Mary didn\'t like him very much.
Tom really should\'ve studied harder for the test.
Tom refused to believe that Mary didn\'t like him.
